ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese, low fat
instructions: Preheat oven to 375.
Spray 8 x 8 baking dish with cooking spray.
Heat oil in skillet, add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add turkey and cook for 3 to 5 minutes each side.
Remove from skillet, and let cool and chop into pieces.
In separate bowl mix sour cream, salsa, cheese, & onion.
Reserve about 1/2 cup of this mixture.
Add chopped turkey to salsa mix and spread over each tortilla.
Roll up & place in baking dish seam side down.
Spread the 1 cup of reserved salsa mix over tortillas.
Bake for 10 minutes.
main_dish.title: Easy Turkey Enchiladas

instructions: In a large bowl prepare salad mix according to package directions.
Toss with dressing of choice.
side_dishes.title: Green Salad

instructions: Preheat oven to 375.
Spray baking dish with cooking spray & place fish in dish.
Season with salt & pepper.
Place veggies on top of fish.
Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, lemon juice & basil in small bowl.
Drizzle over fish & top with cheese.
Cover with foil and bake about 15 minutes until fish flakes easily with fork.
main_dish.title: Cod with Asparagus & Tomatoes

instructions: Place coleslaw mix in skillet with a small amount of water and simmer, covered until tender, about 5 mins.
Drain.
Salt & pepper to taste.
If you want, add a little vinaigrette style dressing, hot sauce, or favorite seasoning before serving.
side_dishes.title: Steamed Shredded Cabbage

instructions: Prepare rice per package directions.
Salt & pepper to taste.

For variety, cook in broth instead of water, toss in some frozen veggies for the last few minutes of cooking, stir in a squeeze of lemon juice and/or 1 tbs olive oil, or toss in a handful of any chopped fresh herbs you have on hand.
side_dishes.title: Rice

instructions: Cut chicken into large cubes.
Heat oil in skillet on medium heat.
Add chicken & season with salt & pepper.
Cook for 5 to 8 minutes until no longer pink inside.
Remove from pan & set aside.
Add shallots, corn, & tomatoes to pan.
Cook for 5 to 8 minutes, then return chicken to pan.
Add lime juice & parsley and heat for a few minutes longer and serve.
main_dish.title: Chicken with Herbed Tomato & Corn

notes: Can prep shallots, tomatoes, & parsley in advance

instructions: Preheat oven to 400.
Toss brussels sprouts with oil and place on baking dish.
Salt and pepper to taste.
Roast for 20-30 minutes until golden brown and tender.
side_dishes.title: Roasted Brussels Sprouts

ingredients: 1 lb red potatoes, washed and quartered
instructions: Boil potatoes in salted water until fork tender, about 20 mins.
Drain and salt & pepper to taste.
side_dishes.title: Boiled Potatoes

instructions: Place all ingredients EXCEPT black beans and kale into slow cooker.
Make sure rice (any rice will work if you don't have wild rice) is covered and add water if needed.
Cover and cook on high for 3 hours.
Remove lid and stir in black beans and salt & pepper.
Replace lid and cook 45 minutes.
Add kale, stir and serve.
This recipe will make plenty of leftovers for lunches or another dinner.
DON'T HAVE A SLOW COOKER?  You could easily do this recipe on the stove top in a large soup pot.
For stove top, cook for about 40 minutes.
main_dish.title: Slow Cooker Black Bean & Wild Rice Soup

ingredients: 2 tbs shredded cheddar cheese, low fat (optional)
instructions: Toss arugula and peaches.
Top with cheddar & pecans (if using), and sprinkle with dressing of choice.
side_dishes.title: Arugula and Peach Salad

ingredients: 3/4 lb boneless chicken breast, thin sliced, cut into strips
instructions: In bowl mix half the garlic & ginger, all the soy sauce, sugar, 1/2 tsp cornstarch, 1/2 tsp salt, and vinegar.
Toss with chicken strips and marinate at room temperature for 15 mins.
Meanwhile, mix remaining cornstarch with the broth.
Heat 1/2 tbs of oil in a large skillet over high.
Add asparagus, scallions, remaining garlic & ginger.
Stir-fry until asparagus is bright green, then add 2 tbs water and cover.
Cook until asparagus in tender but still crisp, about 3 mins.
Remove and set aside.
Pour off any remaining water.
Heat same skillet on high, then add remaining oil.
Add chicken and stir-fry until cooked through & browned (internal temp of 165 degrees), about 3 to 5 mins.
Return asparagus/scallions to skillet and toss to heat through.
Stir in broth/cornstarch mixture and bring to a full boil to thicken.
Remove from heat and serve.
main_dish.title: Asparagus & Chicken Stir Fry

instructions: Cook carrots over simmering water for about 10 mins until tender.
side_dishes.title: Baby Carrots
